context: In 2005, the BPM (Business Process Management) market was segmented by different approaches. Pegasystems competed in the workflow-oriented and case management space. The market was divided into data-centric integration-oriented vendors, workflow-oriented vendors, and content-centric workflow vendors. FileNet (later acquired by IBM in 2006) and other major enterprise software vendors dominated the landscape.

competitors.name: IBM (FileNet, WebSphere)
competitors.notes: Major BPM player with FileNet for content-centric workflow and WebSphere for integration. IBM had been providing process automation technology for over two decades by this time.

competitors.name: TIBCO (Staffware)
competitors.notes: Provided workflow-oriented BPM solutions through Staffware acquisition. Strong in integration-centric solutions for system-intensive processes.

competitors.name: FileNet
competitors.notes: Content-centric workflow-oriented vendor, strong in document-intensive processes. Acquired by IBM in 2006.

competitors.name: Documentum (EMC)
competitors.notes: Document-intensive process management and content management competitor.

competitors.name: Fuego
competitors.notes: Data-centric workflow-oriented BPM vendor focused on workflow automation.

competitors.name: Savvion
competitors.notes: Workflow-oriented BPM vendor providing people-intensive process solutions.

competitors.name: Lombardi
competitors.notes: BPM vendor focused on people-intensive processes, later acquired by IBM in 2009.

competitors.name: Metastorm
competitors.notes: BPM vendor for people-intensive processes involving routing, approving and fulfilling requests.

competitors.name: Ultimus
competitors.notes: Workflow and BPM solution provider for people-intensive business processes.

competitors.name: BEA Systems
competitors.notes: Integration-centric BPM solutions, later acquired by Oracle in 2008.

competitors.name: Oracle
competitors.notes: Enterprise software vendor with BPM capabilities, strengthened position through BEA acquisition.

competitors.name: Microsoft
competitors.notes: Provided integration-oriented BPM solutions as part of broader enterprise software stack.

competitors.name: SAP
competitors.notes: Enterprise software leader with workflow and process management capabilities integrated into ERP systems.
